content: harbor beanie written knit pattern by @chelseacrochets_ this design is inspired by the sleepy and gloomy autumn season of grays harbor and the need to keep my fisherman s head warm for all his early morning and late-night fishing trips i hope this design sparks the same joy it did for me in creating for our loved ones or ourselves recommended yarn & needle size *i used one skein of moonshine juniper moon farm medium/worsted 100g/197 yards *other yarn options- knit picks chroma worsted cascade yarns eco duo *needle size- 5 3 75mm or needle size to hit gauge *gauge- 5 5 sts/ 1 inch or 22 sts/ 4 inches stitches used k- knit ktog- knit two together ssk- slip slip knit co- cast on bor- beginning of round sm- stitch marker pattern this pattern is written in one size large which fits most adults 1 co 94 stitches using the long tail cast on method or any preferred cast on method 2 place bor stitch marker and join in the round k in stockinette for 6 inches double folded brim- 3 fold brim inward and join both the cast on row with the live row you just knit be careful as you align and knit the stitches together to make sure they match up as you go around this will create the double folded brim 4 k in stockinette for 4 inches before placing stitch markers and setting up for the decrease row decreases set up row - you will need 8 stitch markers 5 k 12 place sm k 2 place sm k 20 place sm k 2 place sm k 22 place sm k 2 place sm k 22 place sm k 2 place sm k 10 decreases continued- 6 k up until two stitches before the sm ktog slip sm k 2 slip sm ssk repeat this all the way around to bor sm alternate between one increase row and one regular k row until you have decreased to 7 rounds then rapidly decrease each round until you have only 8 stitches left on your needles finishing touches cut working yarn by at least 4-5 inches use a tapestry needle to weave in the working string into the remaining 8 stitches removing your needles from the project stitch by stitch to close hole at the top of the beanie pull tight and weave in any ends block and lay flat to dry thank you i hope you enjoyed knitting your harbor beanie i would love to see your finished project please feel free to tag me on all social media platforms including ravelry and instagram
